label: 践祚
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: The senso incuded the physical transmission of the sword and necklace (the mirror remained permanently in the Kashikodokoro), the notification of the gods, and the symbolic seating of the Emperor on the Shishinden throne, all carried out under relatively private circumstances. (p. 394) [賢所、紫宸殿]
